data.title: Themes, Motifs & Symbols - T.S. Eliot: Waste Land Themes The Damaged Psyche of Humanity
data.meta_description: Themes - Free download as Word Doc (.doc), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document summarizes major themes, motifs, and symbols in T.S. Eliot's poem The Waste Land. It discusses Eliot's portrayal of the damaged psyche of humanity after World War I and his use of fragmentation to represent the modern world. Eliot drew heavily on myths, religious rituals, and literary history in his works. Key symbols discussed include infertility, death, and the Fisher King, who represents damaged sexuality.
data.text: Themes, Motifs & Symbols - T.S. Eliot: Waste Land Themes The Damaged Psyche of Humanity
